title: hello-nbdev
text:
Nbdev, supercharged software development: https://nbdev.fast.ai
This is a walkthrough of the tutorial from here: https://nbdev.fast.ai/tutorials/tutorial.html
Make sure you are using nbdev >= 2.3.4

title: hello-nbdev
text:
How to use
Our main functionality provides animal response/sounds for a given prompt/name

say_meow('bob')

'Meow bob!'



say_meow('buddy')

'Meow buddy!'

title: core_sounds
text:
source

say_meow

 say_meow (to)

Say meow to someone

#Test's for say_meow:
assert(say_meow("Bob") == "Meow Bob!")
test_eq(say_meow("Bob"), "Meow Bob!")


display(SVG('<svg height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40"/></svg>'))





source


MeowSayer

 MeowSayer (to)

Say Meow to ‘to’ using say_meow
unfortunately the docs for the method in the class are not automatically shown… this is where the show_doc function comes into play, as seen below:

source


MeowSayer.say

 MeowSayer.say ()

Do the saying

o = MeowSayer("Nao")
o.say()

'Meow Nao!'
